intro: Hildebrandtia obcordata var. obcordata, commonly known as the obcordate hildebrandtia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to certain regions of South America, particularly in countries like Brazil and Argentina. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
